sentence.idiomatic: He has lived here since he was young. He is very familiar with the place.
I don't know him very well. It wouldn't be too good if I asked him for a favor.
How is it that you're so familiar with Chinese history?
What do your parents do?
Their company is an import-export business.
The tech guys often have to work overtime.
His illness is still the same as always--not any better and not any worse.
I've spoken to him so many times, but he is still the same way. He hasn't changed at all.
Now with the economy so bad, if the company is able stay as it was that's pretty good.
This film is directed by Zhang Yimou.
I heard that he knows a big director.
I haven't seen one of the movies he has directed.
Let's go out to eat in a little while.
I stayed in Shanghai for two years.
He stayed just a few minutes, then left.
Let's go to Hollywood today.
Will we be able to see some stars?
That depends on our luck. I've only seen some B-list stars. Oh, right--I have a friend that is a filmmaker. He's a little bit more in on things. I'll get him to take us in a while.
Tony, hello! This is my friend, she came to have some fun in Los Angeles.
Welcome. Do you like it here?
It's not bad. I heard that you are a filmmaker?
Yes, I am a director.
Really? What movies have you directed?
Hmm, some independent films. In a while we can go have a look at some of the film studios.
And bring her to the Walk of Fame.
OK. Let's go get something to eat first.
Three people?
Amy!
Tony, what are you doing here?
I'm taking a friend around. Been busy lately?
Same as always. You guys first take a look at the menu, I'll be back in a minute.
Is she an actress?
Yeah. In Hollywood, everyone is in the movie business.
